intro: Koeleria micrathera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grass or slender wheatgrass, is a flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a low-growing perennial grass that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it adaptable to a variety of soil types and environmental conditions.
